tagitem.notes: see ISBT 128 Concatenate Pair 0

tagitem.name: CI_ISBT128_CONCATENATE_LIST_ADDD
tagitem.desc: Sets a pair of label identifiers for ISBT 128 concatenation.
tagitem.notes: see ISBT 128 Concatenate Pair 0

tagitem.name: CI_ISBT128_CONCATENATE_LIST_ADDE
tagitem.desc: Sets a pair of label identifiers for ISBT 128 concatenation.
tagitem.notes: see ISBT 128 Concatenate Pair 0

tagitem.name: CI_ISBT128_CONCATENATE_LIST_ADDF
tagitem.desc: Sets a pair of label identifiers for ISBT 128 concatenation.
tagitem.notes: see ISBT 128 Concatenate Pair 0

tagitem.name: CI_IATA_INDUSTRIAL_2OF5_AIM_ID_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables/Disables AIM ID for IATA_INDUSTRIAL_2OF5
tagitem.notes: Effective only when CI_ALL_AIM_ID_ENABLE is disabled.

tagitem.name: CI_IATA_INDUSTRIAL_2OF5_CHECK_CHARACTER_TRANSMISSION
tagitem.desc: Enables/disables transmission of IATA_INDUSTRIAL_2OF5 check character

tagitem.name: CI_IATA_INDUSTRIAL_2OF5_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables/Disables ability of scanner to decode IATA_INDUSTRIAL_2OF5 labels.

tagitem.name: CI_LABEL_ID_IATA_INDUSTRIAL_2OF5
tagitem.desc: Specifies IATA_INDUSTRIAL_2OF5 label ID to be added to label data
tagitem.notes: The label ID is 3 bytes. The 3 bytes are characters for the label ID. A 00 (hex) value in the first 3 bytes indicates the end of the label ID characters.

tagitem.name: CI_IBM_TRANSMIT_LABELS_IN_CODE39_FORMAT
tagitem.desc: Enable/disables translation of symbology identifier for specified symbologies to Code39 before transmitting label data to an IBM-46XX or an USB OEM host .
tagitem.notes:
When converting to Code39, only the symbology identifier is modified. The data is not converted to Code39 or verified to be valid for Code39.
When setting=01, the following symbologies will be converted to Code39: USB OEM: Code128, Code93, and Codabar IBM-Port 5B: Code128, Code93, and Codabar IBM-Port 9B: Code93 and Codabar

tagitem.name: CI_USB_OEM_SCANNER_DEVICE_USAGE_TYPE
tagitem.desc: Selects the USB-OEM device usage type that will be communicated over the interface by the scanner.
tagitem.notes: Changing this value from the factory setting may be necessary when connecting two of the same scanner type to a POS system.

tagitem.name: CI_LABEL_ID_CONTROL
tagitem.desc: Specifies whether or not to transmit label IDs to host and (if so) whether to attach them as suffix or prefix

tagitem.name: CI_IGNORE_HOST_COMMANDS
tagitem.desc: When set to Ignore, the scanner will ignore all host commands except for those necessary for service mode, flash programming mode, to keep the interface active, and transmit labels.
tagitem.notes:
The options value description coming form the past revision and Museo platform was:
00=Normal (Do not ignore host commands) 01=Ignore
The current value have been updated to:
00=Obey (Do not ignore host commands) 01=Ignore

tagitem.name: CI_INTERFACE_OPTIONS_1
tagitem.desc: Provides for an interface specific control mechanism.
tagitem.notes: Selects the following options in the specfied interfaces: USB OEM - Bit0: 1 = Compatible with MagellanSL Configuration Host Cmd Processing. 0 = Normal Processing. Bit1: 1 = Fake Scanner Configuration Host Cmd Processing. 0 = Normal Processing. Bit2: 1 = Fake Scale Configuration Host Cmd Processing. 0 = Normal Processing. IBM 4683 Port 5B - Bit0: Unused Bit1: 1 = Fake Scanner Configuration Host Cmd Processing. 0 = Normal Processing. Bit2: Unused IBM 4683 Port 9B - Bit0: Unused Bit1: 1 = Fake Scanner Configuration Host Cmd Processing. 0 = Normal Processing. Bit2: Unused RS232 - All bits unused. Keyboard - All bits unused. USB-HID-POS - All bits unused. Wand - All bits unused.

tagitem.name: CI_ISSN_AIM_ID_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables/Disables AIM ID for ISSN
tagitem.notes: Effective only when CI_ALL_AIM_ID_ENABLE is disabled.

tagitem.name: CI_LABEL_ID_ISSN
tagitem.desc: Specifies ISSN label ID to be added to label data.
tagitem.notes: The label ID is 3 bytes. The 3 bytes are characters for the label ID. A 00 (hex) value in the first 3 bytes indicates the end of the label ID characters

tagitem.name: CI_IMAGE_DECODING_LADDER_ACTIVATION_DELAY
tagitem.desc: Specifies minumum number of frames to skip after the trigger pulled, before starting processing 1D labels in Ladder way.

tagitem.name: CI_IMAGE_DECODING_LADDER_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enable/Disable the ability of the scanner to process 1D labels oriented in Ladder way.

tagitem.name: CI_NORMAL_REVERSE_SYMBOL_CONTROL
tagitem.desc: Specifies the options available for decoding normal/negative printed symbols
tagitem.notes: The configuration item applies globally to all the symbologies that support that feature according to Standard AIM Specification: Datamatrix, QR, Micro QR, Aztec and Chinese Sensible Code.

tagitem.name: CI_PARTIAL_LABEL_READING_CONTROL
tagitem.desc: Enable/Disable the option to skip partial label to be read in the boundary of field of view .

tagitem.name: CI_MAX_EXP_TIME_TRIGGERLESS_MODE
tagitem.desc: Specifies the Maximum exposure time when the reading mode is different form Trigger single

tagitem.name: CI_MAX_EXPOSURE_TIMER
tagitem.desc: Specifies the Maximum exposure time.

tagitem.name: CI_IMAGE_DECODING_VL_REVERSE
tagitem.desc: Enable/Disable the ability to decode a negative image.
tagitem.notes: The reverse property is intended at global image level. There is not distinction at single code level. The property affects all 1D and 2D symbologies including Datamatrix and QR that has the additional property: CI_DATAMATRIX_INVERSE_CONTROL. Note:This property also apply to programming label, then must be considered only for Developer/Expert users and not documented in PRG.

tagitem.name: CI_ISBN_AIM_ID_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables/Disables AIM ID for ISBN
tagitem.notes: Effective only when CI_ALL_AIM_ID_ENABLE is disabled.

tagitem.name: CI_LABEL_ID_ISBN
tagitem.desc: Specifies ISBN label ID to be added to label data.
tagitem.notes: The label ID is 3 bytes. The 3 bytes are characters for the label ID. A 00 (hex) value in the first 3 bytes indicates the end of the label ID characters.

tagitem.name: CI_KEYBOARD_CAPS_LOCK_STATE
tagitem.desc: Specifies format in which keyboard interface sends character data
tagitem.notes:
Used by the keyboard wedge and USB keyboard interfaces.
00 = CAPS LOCK Off, send character data in normal format. 01 = CAPS LOCK ON, send character data in reverse case. 02 = Auto CAPS LOCK. This applies to USB keyboard, and Wedge E (AT) interfaces. For other interfaces this setting defaults to CAPS LOCK Off functionality.

tagitem.name: CI_KEYBOARD_COUNTRY_MODE
tagitem.desc: Specifies country/language supported by the keyboard interface and Handheld HID
tagitem.notes: Used by the keyboard wedge and USB keyboard interfaces.

tagitem.name: CI_KEYBOARD_INTER_CODE_DELAY
tagitem.desc: Specifies the delay between labels transmitted to the host for the keyboard interface
tagitem.notes: Used by the keyboard wedge and USB keyboard interfaces.

tagitem.name: CI_KEYBOARD_NUMERIC_KEYPAD
tagitem.desc: Controls if numeric characters will be sent using the standard keys or the numeric keypad.
tagitem.notes: Used by keyboard wedge and USB keyboard.

tagitem.name: CI_WEDGE_NUMLOCK
tagitem.desc: Specifies the setting of the NUMLOCK key in wedge interface
tagitem.notes: Used by the keyboard wedge interface.

tagitem.name: CI_WEDGE_QUIET_INTERVAL
tagitem.desc: Specifies amount of time to look for keyboard activity before scanner breaks keyboard connection in order to transmit data to host
tagitem.notes: Used by the keyboard wedge interface.

tagitem.name: CI_KEYBOARD_SEND_CTRL_CHARACTERS
tagitem.desc: Specifies how keyboard interface transmits ASCII control characters to host
tagitem.notes:
When 00, ASCII characters between 00H and 1FH inclusive are transmitted in the format Ctrl+Key. Special keys are available in the range from 81H to A1
when 01 the behaviours is the same but control keys are sent in the format Ctrl+shift+keys.
When 02 Send characters between 00H and 1FH according to special function-key mapping table (This is used to send keys that are not in normal ASCII set; a unique set is provided for each available scancode set) Used by the keyboard wedge and USB keyboard interfaces.

tagitem.name: CI_USBKB_SPEED
tagitem.desc: Specifies the USB poll rate for USB keyboard

tagitem.name: CI_GOOD_READ_LED_DURATION
tagitem.desc: Specifies the duration of the good read LED indication.

values.value: LED stays on until next trigger pull

tagitem.notes: NOTE: This item will have default master different from all interface classes defaults.

tagitem.name: CI_DATABAR_LIMITED_2D_COMPONENT_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Controls requirement that a 2D label component be decoded when an GS1 DataBar Limited base label is decoded.
tagitem.notes: When enabled, if a Databar Limited label is decoded which has the 2D linkage flag set, the 2D component must also be decoded or the base label will be discarded. When disabled, only the Databar Limited base label will be decoded and transmitted regardless of the state of the linkage flag.

tagitem.name: CI_DATABAR_LIMITED_AIM_ID_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables/Disables AIM ID for GS1 DataBar Limited
tagitem.notes: Effective only when CI_ALL_AIM_ID_ENABLE is disabled.

tagitem.name: CI_DATABAR_LIMITED_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables/disables ability of scanner to decode GS1 DataBar Limited labels

tagitem.name: CI_LABEL_ID_DATABAR_LIMITED
tagitem.desc: Specifies GS1 DataBar Limited label ID to be added to label data
tagitem.notes: The label ID is 3 bytes. The 3 bytes are characters for the label ID. A 00 (hex) value in the first 3 bytes indicates the end of the label ID characters.

tagitem.name: CI_DATABAR_LIMITED_EAN128_EMULATION
tagitem.desc: Enables/disables GS1-128 emulation for GS1 DataBar Limited.

tagitem.name: CI_DATABAR_LIMITED_COMPOSITE_AIM_ID_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables/Disables AIM ID for GS1 DataBar Limited Composite
tagitem.notes: Effective only when CI_ALL_AIM_ID_ENABLE is disabled.

tagitem.name: CI_LABEL_ID_DATABAR_LIMITED_COMPOSITE
tagitem.desc: Specifies GS1 DataBar Limited Composite label ID to be added to label data.
tagitem.notes: The label ID is 3 bytes. The 3 bytes are characters for the label ID. A 00 (hex) value in the first 3 bytes indicates the end of the label ID characters.

tagitem.name: CI_LABEL_EDIT_SCRIPT_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables Advanced Formatting and User Label Edit Scripts.
tagitem.notes: For Label Editing to execute successfully, the Label Edit script must be loaded in addition to enabling this configuration item.

tagitem.name: CI_ULE_GENERIC_CONFIG
tagitem.desc: Generic data store for use with User Label Edit scripts.
tagitem.notes: This configuration item will hold generic configurable data that will be used by a ULE script. The meaning of the data is open to the script writer.

tagitem.name: CI_CASE_CONVERSION
tagitem.desc: Changes the case of all alphabetic characters to upper or lower case.

tagitem.name: CI_CHARACTER_CONVERSION
tagitem.desc: Converts transmission characters from one value to another.
tagitem.notes:
There are 8 characters in this conversion string: Characters [1] [2] [3] [4] [5] [6] [7] [8].
The following conversions occur: Character [1] is converted to Character [2]; If Character [1] is 0xFF, there is no conversion. Character [3] is converted to Character [4]; If Character [3] is 0xFF, there is no conversion. Character [5] is converted to Character [6]; If Character [5] is 0xFF, there is no conversion. Character [7] is converted to Character [8]; If Character [7] is 0xFF, there is no conversion.

tagitem.name: CI_GLOBAL_PREFIX
tagitem.desc: Specifies prefix that is added to beginning of label transmission.
tagitem.notes: The first 00 hex value terminates the string.

tagitem.name: CI_GLOBAL_SUFFIX
tagitem.desc: Specifies suffix that is added to end of label transmission.
tagitem.notes: The first 00 hex value terminates the string.

tagitem.name: CI_CODE39_LAPOSTE_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables/disables ability of scanner to decode Code39 La Poste labels

tagitem.name: CI_LABEL_ID_CODE39_LAPOSTE
tagitem.desc: Specifies La Poste 39 label ID to be added to label data
tagitem.notes: Undocumented in PRG. It is left only for backward comaptibility.

tagitem.name: CI_GREEN_SPOT_DURATION
tagitem.desc: Specifies the duration of the good read pointer beam after a good read

tagitem.name: CI_AIMING_DURATION_TIMER
tagitem.desc: Specifies the frame of time the aiming pointer remains on after decoding a label, when in trigger single mode and Pick Mode is disabled.
tagitem.notes: Valid only when CI_READ_MODE

tagitem.name: CI_AIMING_POINTER_TIMEOUT
tagitem.desc: Specifies time to wait before shutting off laser when no label is found

tagitem.name: CI_MATRIX_2OF5_AIM_ID_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables/Disables AIM ID for Matrix 2 of 5
tagitem.notes: Effective only when CI_ALL_AIM_ID_ENABLE is disabled.

tagitem.name: CI_MATRIX_2OF5_CHECK_CHARACTER_CALCULATION
tagitem.desc: Enables/Disables calculation and verification of optional Matrix 2 of 5 check character

tagitem.name: CI_MATRIX_2OF5_CHECK_CHARACTER_TRANSMISSION
tagitem.desc: Enables/disables transmission of optional Matrix 2 of 5 check character

tagitem.name: CI_MATRIX_2OF5_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables/Disables ability of scanner to decode Matrix 2 of 5 labels.

tagitem.name: CI_LABEL_ID_MATRIX_2OF5
tagitem.desc: Specifies Matrix 2 of 5 label ID to be added to label data
tagitem.notes: The label ID is 3 bytes. The 3 bytes are characters for the label ID. A 00 (hex) value in the first 3 bytes indicates the end of the label ID characters.

tagitem.name: CI_MATRIX_2OF5_LENGTH_1
tagitem.desc: Specifies one of the barcode lengths for Matrix 2 of 5 length control
tagitem.notes: Length 1 is the minimum label length if in variable length mode, or the first fixed length if in fixed length mode. Length includes the barcodes check and data characters.

tagitem.name: CI_MATRIX_2OF5_LENGTH_2
tagitem.desc: Specifies one of the barcode lengths for Matrix 2 of 5 length control

values.value: Ignore this length. Only one fixed length.

tagitem.notes: Length 2 is the maximum label length if in variable length mode, or the second fixed length if in fixed length mode. Length includes the barcodes check and data characters.

tagitem.name: CI_MATRIX_2OF5_LENGTH_CONTROL
tagitem.desc: Specifies either variable-length decoding or fixed-length decoding for Matrix 2 of 5
tagitem.notes: For variable-length decoding, a minimum length may be set; for fixed-length decoding, two different lengths may be set

tagitem.name: CI_MICRO_PDF_AIM_ID_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables/Disables AIM ID for Micro PDF
tagitem.notes: Effective only when CI_ALL_AIM_ID_ENABLE is disabled.

tagitem.name: CI_MICRO_PDF_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables/disables ability of scanner to decode MicroPDF labels

tagitem.name: CI_LABEL_ID_MICRO_PDF
tagitem.desc: Specifies MicroPDF label ID to be added to label data
tagitem.notes: The label ID is 3 bytes. The 3 bytes are characters for the label ID. A 00 (hex) value in the first 3 bytes indicates the end of the label ID characters.

tagitem.name: CI_MICRO_PDF_LENGTH_1
tagitem.desc: Specifies one of the barcode lengths for MicroPDF length control.
tagitem.notes: Length 1 is the minimum label length if in variable length mode, or the first fixed length if in fixed length mode. Length includes the barcodes data characters only. Any value > 366 (0x16E) will be considered to be 366.

tagitem.name: CI_MICRO_PDF_LENGTH_2
tagitem.desc: Specifies one of the barcode lengths for MicroPDF length control.

values.value: Ignore this length. Only one fixed length.

tagitem.notes: Length 2 is the maximum label length if in variable length mode, or the second fixed length if in fixed length mode. Length includes the barcodes data characters only. Any value > 366 (0x16E) will be considered to be 366.

tagitem.name: CI_MICRO_PDF_LENGTH_CONTROL
tagitem.desc: Specifies either variable-length decoding or fixed-length decoding for MicroPDF.
tagitem.notes: For variable length decoding, minimum and maximum lengths may be set. For fixed length decoding, two different explicit lengths may be set.

tagitem.name: CI_MICROPDF_128_EMULATION
tagitem.desc: Specifies which AIM Id to use for MicroPDF labels when doing Code 128 or GS1-128 emulation.

values.value: Micro PDF AIM Id and label type when doing EAN128 or Code 128
Code 128 / EAN128 AIM Id and label type when doing EAN128 or Code 128 emulation

tagitem.notes:
If this configuration item is 00 and CI_ALL_AIM_ID_ENABLE is enabled and doing EAN128 or Code 128 emulation, the MicroPDF AIM Id type is used (]L3, ]L4 or ]L5).
If this configuration item is 00, and doing EAN128 or Code 128 emulation, the label type remains MicroPDF. CI_ALL_AIM_ID_ENABLE must be disabled.
If this configuration item is 01 CI_ALL_AIM_ID_ENABLE is enabled and doing EAN128 or Code 128 emulation, the Code 128 / EAN 128 AIM Id type is used (]C0, ]C1 or ]C2).
If this configuration item is 01, and doing EAN128 or Code 128 emulation, the label type is changed to either EAN128 or Code 128. CI_ALL_AIM_ID_ENABLE must be disabled.

tagitem.name: CI_MICROQR_AIM_ID_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables/Disables AIM ID for Micro QR
tagitem.notes: Effective only when CI_ALL_AIM_ID_ENABLE is disabled.

tagitem.name: CI_MICROQR_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables/disables ability of scanner to decode Micro QR labels

tagitem.name: CI_LABEL_ID_MICROQR
tagitem.desc: Specifies MicroQR label ID to be added to label data

tagitem.name: CI_MICROQR_LENGTH_1
tagitem.desc: Specifies one of the barcode lengths for Micro QR length control

tagitem.name: CI_MICROQR_LENGTH_2
tagitem.desc: Specifies one of the barcode lengths for Micro QR length control

values.value: Ignore this length. Only one fixed length.

tagitem.notes: Length 2 is the maximum label length if in variable length mode, or the second fixed length if in fixed length mode. Length includes the barcodes data characters only

tagitem.name: CI_MICROQR_LENGTH_CONTROL
tagitem.desc: Specifies either variable-length decoding or fixed-length decoding for Micro QR

tagitem.name: CI_MSI_AIM_ID_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables/Disables AIM ID for MSI
tagitem.notes: Effective only when CI_ALL_AIM_ID_ENABLE is disabled.

tagitem.name: CI_MSI_CHECK_CHARACTER_CALCULATION
tagitem.desc: Enables/Disables calculation and verification of optional MSI check character

tagitem.name: CI_MSI_CHECK_CHARACTER_TRANSMISSION
tagitem.desc: Enables/disables transmission of optional MSI check character

tagitem.name: CI_MSI_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables/Disables ability of scanner to decode MSI labels.

tagitem.name: CI_LABEL_ID_MSI
tagitem.desc: Specifies MSI label ID to be added to label data
tagitem.notes: The label ID is 3 bytes. The 3 bytes are characters for the label ID. A 00 (hex) value in the first 3 bytes indicates the end of the label ID characters.

tagitem.name: CI_MSI_LENGTH_1
tagitem.desc: Specifies one of the barcode lengths for MSI length control
tagitem.notes: Length 1 is the minimum label length if in variable length mode, or the first fixed length if in fixed length mode. Length includes the barcodes start, stop, check and data characters. The length must include at least one data character.

tagitem.name: CI_MSI_LENGTH_2
tagitem.desc: Specifies one of the barcode lengths for MSI length control

values.value: Ignore this length. Only one fixed length.

tagitem.notes: Length 2 is the maximum label length if in variable length mode, or the second fixed length if in fixed length mode. Length includes the barcodes check and data characters.

tagitem.name: CI_MSI_LENGTH_CONTROL
tagitem.desc: Specifies either variable-length decoding or fixed-length decoding for MSI
tagitem.notes: For variable-length decoding, a minimum length may be set; for fixed-length decoding, two different lengths may be set

tagitem.name: CI_MAXICODE_AIM_ID_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables/Disables AIM ID for Maxicode
tagitem.notes: Effective only when CI_ALL_AIM_ID_ENABLE is disabled.

tagitem.name: CI_MAXICODE_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables/disables ability of scanner to decode Maxicode labels

tagitem.name: CI_LABEL_ID_MAXICODE
tagitem.desc: Specifies Maxicode label ID to be added to label data

tagitem.name: CI_MAXICODE_LENGTH_1
tagitem.desc: Specifies one of the digits Label lengths for Maxicode length control.

tagitem.name: CI_MAXICODE_LENGTH_2
tagitem.desc: Specifies one of the digits Label lengths for Maxicode length control.

values.value: Ignore this length. Only one fixed length.

tagitem.notes: Length 2 is the maximum label length if in variable length mode, or the second fixed length if in fixed length mode. Length includes the barcodes data characters only

tagitem.name: CI_MAXICODE_LENGTH_CONTROL
tagitem.desc: Specifies either variable-length decoding or fixed-length decoding for Maxicode.

tagitem.name: CI_MAXICODE_PRIMARY_MESSAGE_TRANSMISSION
tagitem.desc: Enables/disables the transmission of only the Primary Message when the Secondary Message is not readable.

tagitem.name: CI_GLOBAL_MID_LABEL_ID
tagitem.desc: Specifies mid-label id that is added for transmission between the labels of a two label pair.
tagitem.notes: The first 00 hex value terminates the string.

tagitem.name: CI_CODE39_PHARMACODE_AIM_ID_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables/Disables AIM ID for C39 Pharmacode
tagitem.notes: Effective only when CI_ALL_AIM_ID_ENABLE is disabled.

tagitem.name: CI_CODE32_CHECK_CHARACTER_TRANSMISSION
tagitem.desc: Enables/disables transmission of Code 32 check character

tagitem.name: CI_CODE32_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables/disables ability of scanner to decode Code 32 labels
tagitem.notes: The use of VL requires also that Code 39 must be enabled.

tagitem.name: CI_LABEL_ID_CODE32
tagitem.desc: Specifies Code 32 label ID to be added to label data
tagitem.notes: The label ID is 3 bytes. The 3 bytes are characters for the label ID. A 00 (hex) value in the first 3 bytes indicates the end of the label ID characters.

tagitem.name: CI_CODE32_START_STOP_CHARACTER_TRANSMISSION
tagitem.desc: Enables/disables transmission of start and stop characters for Code 32

tagitem.name: CI_PDF417_AIM_ID_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables/Disables AIM ID for PDF417
tagitem.notes: Effective only when CI_ALL_AIM_ID_ENABLE is disabled.

tagitem.name: CI_PDF417_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables/Disables ability of processing PDF417 labels read by a handheld scanner attached to the auxillary port.

tagitem.name: CI_LABEL_ID_PDF417
tagitem.desc: Specifies PDF417 label ID to be added to label data
tagitem.notes: The label ID is 3 bytes. The 3 bytes are characters for the label ID. A 00 (hex) value in the first 3 bytes indicates the end of the label ID characters.

tagitem.name: CI_PDF417_LENGTH_1
tagitem.desc: Specifies one of the barcode lengths for PDF417 length control.
tagitem.notes: Length 1 is the minimum label length if in variable length mode, or the first fixed length if in fixed length mode. Length includes the barcodes data characters only. Any value > 2710 (-0x0A96) will be considered to be 2710.

tagitem.name: CI_PDF417_LENGTH_2
tagitem.desc: Specifies one of the barcode lengths for PDF417 length control.

values.value: Ignore this length. Only one fixed length.

tagitem.notes: Length 2 is the maximum label length if in variable length mode, or the second fixed length if in fixed length mode. Length includes the barcodes data characters only. Any value > 2710 (-0x0A96) will be considered to be 2710.

tagitem.name: CI_PDF417_LENGTH_CONTROL
tagitem.desc: Specifies either variable-length decoding or fixed-length decoding for PDF417
tagitem.notes: For variable length decoding, minimum and maximum lengths may be set. For fixed length decoding, two different explicit lengths may be set.

tagitem.name: CI_PDF417_MULTIFRAME_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables/disables ability of scanner to decode a PDF 417 label using multiple frames.

tagitem.name: CI_PDF417_PERMIT_ZERO_LENGTH
tagitem.desc: Enables/disables the decoding control of the codeword for internal length check in a PDF417 label.

tagitem.name: CI_POSTAL_AUSTRALIAN_AIM_ID_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables/Disables AIM ID for Australian Postal Code
tagitem.notes: Effective only when CI_ALL_AIM_ID_ENABLE is disabled.

tagitem.name: CI_LABEL_ID_POSTAL_AUSTRALIAN
tagitem.desc: Specifies Australian Postal Code label ID to be added to label data

tagitem.name: CI_POSTAL_POSTNET_AIM_ID_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables/Disables AIM ID for Postnet Postal Code
tagitem.notes: Effective only when CI_ALL_AIM_ID_ENABLE is disabled.

tagitem.name: CI_POSTAL_PORTUGAL_AIM_ID_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables/Disables AIM ID for Portugal Postal Code
tagitem.notes: Effective only when CI_ALL_AIM_ID_ENABLE is disabled.

tagitem.name: CI_LABEL_ID_POSTAL_PORTUGAL
tagitem.desc: Specifies Portugal Postal Code label ID to be added to label data

tagitem.name: CI_POSTAL_JAPANESE_AIM_ID_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables/Disables AIM ID for Japan Postal Code
tagitem.notes: Effective only when CI_ALL_AIM_ID_ENABLE is disabled.

tagitem.name: CI_LABEL_ID_POSTAL_JAPANESE
tagitem.desc: Specifies Japan Postal Code label ID to be added to label data

tagitem.name: CI_POSTAL_KIX_AIM_ID_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables/Disables AIM ID for KIX Postal Code
tagitem.notes: Effective only when CI_ALL_AIM_ID_ENABLE is disabled.

tagitem.name: CI_LABEL_ID_POSTAL_KIX
tagitem.desc: Specifies Kix Postal Code label ID to be added to label data

tagitem.name: CI_PLESSEY_AIM_ID_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables/Disables AIM ID for Plessey
tagitem.notes: Effective only when CI_ALL_AIM_ID_ENABLE is disabled.

tagitem.name: CI_PLESSEY_CHECK_CHARACTER_CALCULATION
tagitem.desc: Enables/Disables calculation and verification of optional Plessey check character

values.value: Plessey std and Anker check char verification

tagitem.notes:
00=Disable
Bit values 01=Plessey std check char 02=Anker check char

tagitem.name: CI_PLESSEY_CHECK_CHARACTER_TRANSMISSION
tagitem.desc: Enables/disables transmission of optional Plessey check character

tagitem.name: CI_PLESSEY_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables/Disables ability of scanner to decode Plessey labels.

tagitem.name: CI_LABEL_ID_PLESSEY
tagitem.desc: Specifies Plessey label ID to be added to label data
tagitem.notes: The label ID is 3 bytes. The 3 bytes are characters for the label ID. A 00 (hex) value in the first 3 bytes indicates the end of the label ID characters.

tagitem.name: CI_PLESSEY_LENGTH_1
tagitem.desc: Specifies one of the barcode lengths for Plessey length control
tagitem.notes: Length 1 is the minimum label length if in variable length mode, or the first fixed length if in fixed length mode. Length includes the barcodes start, stop, check and data characters. The length must include at least one data character.

tagitem.name: CI_PLESSEY_LENGTH_2
tagitem.desc: Specifies one of the barcode lengths for Plessey length control

values.value: Ignore this length. Only one fixed length.

tagitem.notes: Length 2 is the maximum label length if in variable length mode, or the second fixed length if in fixed length mode. Length includes the barcodes check and data characters.

tagitem.name: CI_PLESSEY_LENGTH_CONTROL
tagitem.desc: Specifies either variable-length decoding or fixed-length decoding for Plessey
tagitem.notes: For variable-length decoding, a minimum length may be set; for fixed-length decoding, two different lengths may be set

tagitem.name: CI_POSTAL_IMB_AIM_ID_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables/Disables AIM ID for IMB Postal Code
tagitem.notes: Effective only when CI_ALL_AIM_ID_ENABLE is disabled.

tagitem.name: CI_LABEL_ID_POSTAL_IMB
tagitem.desc: Specifies IMB Postal Code label ID to be added to label data

tagitem.name: CI_LABEL_ID_POSTNET
tagitem.desc: Specifies Postnet Postal Code label ID to be added to label data
tagitem.notes: Valid both for Postnet and Postent BB'

tagitem.name: CI_POSTNET_BB_CONTROL
tagitem.desc: Controls ability of scanner to decode B and B' fields of Postnet labels.

tagitem.name: CI_POSTAL_CODE_SELECTION
tagitem.desc: Enables/disables ability of scanner to decode Postal labels specifying also the postal symbology
tagitem.notes: More values can be added.

tagitem.name: CI_POSTAL_PLANET_AIM_ID_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables/Disables AIM ID for Postal Planet Code
tagitem.notes: Effective only when CI_ALL_AIM_ID_ENABLE is disabled.

tagitem.name: CI_LABEL_ID_POSTAL_PLANET
tagitem.desc: Specifies Postal Planet Code label ID to be added to label data

tagitem.name: CI_POSTAL_ROYAL_MAIL_AIM_ID_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables/Disables AIM ID for Royal Postal Code
tagitem.notes: Effective only when CI_ALL_AIM_ID_ENABLE is disabled.

tagitem.name: CI_LABEL_ID_POSTAL_ROYAL_MAIL
tagitem.desc: Specifies Royal Postal Code label ID to be added to label data

tagitem.name: CI_POSTAL_SWEDISH_AIM_ID_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables/Disables AIM ID for Swedish Postal Code
tagitem.notes: Effective only when CI_ALL_AIM_ID_ENABLE is disabled.

tagitem.name: CI_LABEL_ID_POSTAL_SWEDISH
tagitem.desc: Specifies Swedish Postal Code label ID to be added to label data

tagitem.name: CI_DO_PRICE_WEIGHT_CHECK
tagitem.desc: Enables/disables calculation and verification of price/weight check digits
tagitem.notes: Applies to all UPCA labels with a number-system character of 2 and EAN/JAN13 labels with a Flag1 digit of 2

tagitem.name: CI_CODE39_PZN_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables/disables ability of scanner to decode Code39 PZN labels
tagitem.notes: This tag only support for VL

tagitem.name: CI_LABEL_ID_CODE39_PZN
tagitem.desc: Specifies PZN label ID to be added to label data
tagitem.notes: Undocumented in PRG. It is left only for backward comaptibility. This tag only support for VL

tagitem.name: CI_QR_CODE _AIM_ID_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables/Disables AIM ID for QR Code
tagitem.notes: Effective only when CI_ALL_AIM_ID_ENABLE is disabled.

tagitem.name: CI_QRCODE_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables/disables ability of scanner to decode QR Code labels

tagitem.name: CI_LABEL_ID_QR_CODE
tagitem.desc: Specifies QR Code label ID to be added to label data

tagitem.name: CI_QRCODE_LENGTH_1
tagitem.desc: Specifies one of the digits Label lengths for QR Code length control.

tagitem.name: CI_QRCODE_LENGTH_2
tagitem.desc: Specifies one of the digits Label lengths for QR Code length control.

values.value: Ignore this length. Only one fixed length.

tagitem.notes: Length 2 is the maximum label length if in variable length mode, or the second fixed length if in fixed length mode. Length includes the barcodes data characters only.

tagitem.name: CI_QRCODE_LENGTH_CONTROL
tagitem.desc: Specifies either variable-length decoding or fixed-length decoding for QR Code.

tagitem.name: CI_QRCODE_MULTIFRAME_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables/disables ability of scanner to decode a QR Code label using multiple frames.

tagitem.name: CI_RS232_ACK_CHARACTER
tagitem.desc: Specifies ASCII character to be used as ACK character (default 06hex)
tagitem.notes:
Setting to previously defined characters such as XON, XOFF, or host commands conflicts with normal operation of these characters; 8-bit data is not recognized when CI_RS232_NUMBER_OF_DATA_BITS = 7
ASCII characters or any hex value from 0 to FF.

tagitem.name: CI_RS232_ACK_NAK_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables/disables ability of scanner to support RS232 ACK/NAK protocol

values.value: Enable ACK/NAK for label transmission and host-cmd acknowledge

tagitem.notes: Ignored when CI_RS232_Host_Echo is enabled

tagitem.name: CI_RS232_ACK_NAK_RETRY_COUNT
tagitem.desc: Specifies number of times scanner retries label transmission due to retry condition

tagitem.name: CI_RS232_ACK_NAK_TIMEOUT_VALUE
tagitem.desc: Specifies time scanner waits for ACK character from host following label transmission

tagitem.name: CI_RS232_BAUD_RATE
tagitem.desc: Specifies baud rate required for sending and receiving data
tagitem.notes: Settings higher than 0x07 (115.2K) are only used when the RS232 Debug interface is selected. For RS232-STD and RS232-WN, these settings will default to 9600 baud operation.

tagitem.name: CI_RS232_BEEP_ON_ASCII_BEL
tagitem.desc: Enables/disables ability of scanner to beep on receiving an ASCII BEL (07 hex) from the host

tagitem.name: CI_RS232_NUMBER_OF_DATA_BITS
tagitem.desc: Specifies number of data bits required for sending and receiving data
tagitem.notes:
[BASE STATION] Due to STM32 cortex M3 MCU limitation, Marco Polo Base STM32F2 based MCU will not support RS232 interface setting 7 data bits and no parity option
It will run as RS232 interface setting 8 data bits and no parity option instead.

tagitem.name: CI_RS232_DISABLE_COMMAND_VALUE
tagitem.desc: Specifies the value of the host command used to enable the scanner.
tagitem.notes:
Setting to previously defined characters such as XON, XOFF, or other host commands conflicts with normal operation of these characters; 8-bit data is not recognized when CI_RS232_NUMBER_OF_DATA_BITS = 7
ASCII characters or any hex value from 0 to FF.

tagitem.name: CI_RS232_ENABLE_COMMAND_VALUE
tagitem.desc: Specifies the value of the host command used to enable the scanner.
tagitem.notes:
Setting to previously defined characters such as XON, XOFF, or other host commands conflicts with normal operation of these characters; 8-bit data is not recognized when CI_RS232_NUMBER_OF_DATA_BITS = 7
ASCII characters or any hex value from 0 to FF.

tagitem.name: CI_RS232_ACK_NAK_ERROR_HANDLING
tagitem.desc: Specifies method scanner uses to handle receive errors detected while waiting for ACK character from host

values.value: Process error as valid ACK character
Process error as valid NAK character

tagitem.notes: Errors include unrecognized host commands and communication errors

tagitem.name: CI_RS232_HANDSHAKE_CONTROL
tagitem.desc: Specifies the hardware or software handshaking used by RS232
tagitem.notes:
00=RTS - RTS is asserted during transmissions. CTS is ignored.
01=RTS/CTS - RTS is asserted during transmissions. CTS gates transmissions.
02=RTS/XON/XOFF - RTS is asserted during transmissions. CTS is ignored. XON and XOFF gate transmissions.
03=RTS On/CTS - RTS is always asserted. CTS gates transmissions.
04=RTS/CTS scan control - RTS is asserted during transmissions. CTS gates transmissions and controls enable and disable state of scanner.

tagitem.name: CI_INTER_CHARACTER_DELAY
tagitem.desc: Specifies delay between the end of one character and the beginning of the next.
tagitem.notes:
Used by RS232, Wedge, and USB keyboard interfaces
RS232: 0 = no intercharacter delay
Keyboard Wedge: 0 = no intercharacter delay
Nonzero values specify one-half of the delay inserted between scancodes within each character.
USB Keyboard: always uses a value of 0 = 1 ms USB Host poll rate
Nonzero values less than 25 are 10 ms increments in USB Host poll rate. Values greater than 25 result in a USB Host poll rate of 255 ms. The host may not support all poll rate increments.
Note: This tag is not applied for Orion Corded and Marco Polo Base on interface USB keyboard

tagitem.name: CI_RS232_NAK_CHARACTER
tagitem.desc: Specifies ASCII character to be used as NAK character (default 15hex)
tagitem.notes:
Setting to previously defined characters such as XON, XOFF, or host commands conflicts with normal operation of these characters; 8-bit data is not recognized when CI_RS232_NUMBER_OF_DATA_BITS = 7
Any ASCII character or hex value from 0 to FF

tagitem.name: CI_RS232_PARITY
tagitem.desc: Specifies parity required for sending and receiving data

tagitem.name: CI_RS232_NUMBER_OF_STOP_BITS
tagitem.desc: Specifies number of stop bits required for sending and receiving data

tagitem.name: CI_RS232_INDICATE_TRANSMISSION_FAILURE
tagitem.desc: Enables/disables bad-label indication on transmission failure in ACK/NAK mode.

tagitem.name: CI_S25_AIM_ID_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables/Disables AIM ID for S2of5
tagitem.notes: Effective only when CI_ALL_AIM_ID_ENABLE is disabled.

tagitem.name: CI_S25_CHECK_CHARACTER_CALCULATION
tagitem.desc: Enables/Disables calculation and verification of optional Standard 2-of-5 check character
tagitem.notes: When disabled, any check character in the label is treated as a data character.

tagitem.name: CI_S25_CHECK_CHAR_TXMIT
tagitem.desc: Enables/Disables transmission of optional Standard 2-of-5 check character.
tagitem.notes: Applies when CI_S25_CHECK_CHARACTER is enabled; ignored when CI_FULL_LABEL_EDIT is enabled.

tagitem.name: CI_S25_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables/Disables ability of scanner to decode Standard 2-of-5 labels.
tagitem.notes: This item must be enabled also to decode a symbology called Discrete 2 0f 5. In that case is necessary to enable additionally CI_INDUSTRIAL_2OF5_ENABLE

tagitem.name: CI_LABEL_ID_S25
tagitem.desc: Specifies Standard 2-of-5 label ID to be added to the label data
tagitem.notes: The label ID is 3 bytes. The 3 bytes are characters for the label ID. A 00 (hex) value in the first 3 bytes indicates the end of the label ID characters.

tagitem.name: CI_S25_LENGTH_1
tagitem.desc: Specifies one of the barcode lengths for Standard 2-of-5 length control.
tagitem.notes: Length 1 is the minimum label length if in variable length mode, or the first fixed length if in fixed length mode. Length includes the barcodes check and data characters.

tagitem.name: CI_S25_LENGTH_2
tagitem.desc: Specifies one of the barcode lengths for Standard 2-of-5 length control.

values.value: Ignore this length. Only one fixed length.

tagitem.notes: Length 2 is the maximum label length if in variable length mode, or the second fixed length if in fixed length mode. Length includes the barcodes check and data characters.

tagitem.name: CI_S25_LENGTH_CONTROL
tagitem.desc: Specifies either variable length decoding or fixed length decoding for Standard 2-of-5
tagitem.notes: For variable length decoding, a minimum length may be set;for fixed length decoding two different lengths may be set. Software for variable-length decoding will check both the minimum and maximum length.

tagitem.name: CI_STAND_MODE_FLASH_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables/disabled the LED flash when the handheld is in stand mode.

tagitem.name: CI_STAND_ILLUMINATION_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Controls the illumination status while the reading mode is stand mode and the scanner is in object detection status.
tagitem.notes: The option 03=Infrared is not supported and the same value is mapped to 00=Off

tagitem.name: CI_STAND_DETECTION
tagitem.desc: Specifies the behavior of the scanner when placed in a stand that contains autorecognition hardware or docked in the base station.
tagitem.notes:
Valid only for devices with stand autorecognition.
The base autorecognignition is based for HH device on the presence into the cradle.
The stand autorecognition is based for corded devices on motion absence due to the stand postion.
when HH is placed in the base station, if CI_STAND_DETECTION is: + 00 : then HH remains the current reading mode. + 01 : then HH switches to Stand mode + 02 : then HH switches to Always on mode + 03 : then HH switches to Flashing mode

tagitem.name: CI_STAND_MODE_SENSITIVITY
tagitem.desc: Sets the sensitivity level for stand mode wakeup

tagitem.name: CI_DOUBLE_READ_TIMEOUT
tagitem.desc: Specifies minimum time between consecutive good reads of same label
tagitem.notes: In normal usage the double read timer should always be set higher than 1. Due to the way the software handles the timer the actual timer value (when set to 1) is between 0 mS and 5mS. A settings of 1 is generally used for testing purposes only.

tagitem.name: CI_ELAPSE_TIME
tagitem.desc: Determines the amount of time that the scanner stays in scan on state once the state is entered

tagitem.name: CI_FLASH_OFF_TIME
tagitem.desc: Specifies the OFF time for the imager while in Flash mode
tagitem.notes: Works in conjunction with software trigger. See CI_READ_MODE.

tagitem.name: CI_FLASH_ON_TIME
tagitem.desc: Specifies the ON time for the imager while in Flash mode
tagitem.notes: Works in conjunction with software trigger. See CI_READ_MODE.

tagitem.name: CI_LABEL_GONE_TIMEOUT
tagitem.desc: Specifies the amount of time segments are stored by the software before being discarded if a label has not been successfully decoded during the current label in volume session.
tagitem.notes:
The "Label in volume session" is defined as the time between when the label gone time is first started until the label gone timer expires.
The maximum amount of time before the label gone timer expiration processing takes place can be the configured amount of time (configurable) + the maximum exposure period.
In normal usage the label gone timer should always be set higher than 1. Due to the way the software handles the timer the actual timer value (when set to 1) is between 0 mS and 5mS. Settings of 0 and 1 are generally used for testing purposes only.

tagitem.name: CI_MULTIPLE_LABEL_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Specifies the ability of the scanner to decode and transmit a set of code labels in a specific volume and in a sigle frame of time.
tagitem.notes:
When in Multiple Labels per Frame the HH beeps and turn on the good read led indication for each code read in a frame.
When multiple labels are enabled, ISBT pairing, ABC codabar pairing, composites are not allowed.

tagitem.name: CI_MULTIPLE_LABEL_TRANSMIT_SYMBOLOGY
tagitem.desc: Specifies the transmission ordering by a configured list of code symbologies, when Multi Label per Frame is enabled.
tagitem.notes:
When CI_MULTIPLE_LABEL_TRANSMIT_SYMBOLOGY is configured at value different from 0x000000000000 the labels are ordered first by the configured output filter represented by the six bytes mask , then in random order depending on the reading time sequence. All read labels will be also transmitted as unspecified symbologies eventually present in the volume. For each label decoded in the volume the HH signal the standard beeper and led indications.
As mapping table for Symbologies identifier see SRS.
Example 1: If a volume contains four label that must be decode in Mutltiple Label per Frame and ordered by this sequence: First Code: Code39; Second Code: Datamatrix; Third Code: Code 128; Fourth Code: Aztec ==> Then Set the value to 0x240E0C4E0000
Example 2: Set the value to 0x000000000000 when not using the symbolgy ordering the correspondend to option is Any Type.

tagitem.name: CI_MULTIPLE_LABEL_TRANSMIT_ORDER
tagitem.desc: Specifies the transmission ordering by code length, when Multi Label per Frame is enabled.
tagitem.notes: This item can be used in conjunction with CI_MULTIPLE_LABEL_TRANSMIT_SYMBOLOGY which is prior to the lasct one.

tagitem.name: CI_OBJECT_GONE_TIMER
tagitem.desc: Specifies the amount of time the scanner takes the Illuminator ON, after a not decoded object is gone when in stand reading mode.
tagitem.notes: NOTE: This item will have default master different from all interface classes defaults.

tagitem.name: CI_MOBILE_PHONE_DURATION
tagitem.desc: Specifies the number of frames processed by the decoding library during the Mobile Phone mode active phase.

tagitem.name: CI_MOBILE_PHONE_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables/Disables a shift of illumination pulse when the device calculates a specific level of image saturation.

tagitem.name: CI_PICK_MODE_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Specifies the ability of the scanner to decoded labels only when they are at the center of the aiming pattern or close to it
tagitem.notes:
This feature is not compatible with Multiple Labels Reading in a volume: CI_DECODE_MULTIPLE_LABELS_ENABLE.
The Pick Mode is active only while the scanner operates with CI_READ_MODE=Trigger Single. If the scanner switches to a different Read Mode the pick mode is automatically disabled.
The Pick Mode is always active when the scanner enter the Programming label Mode.

tagitem.name: CI_MOBILE_PHONE_DARK_RATE
tagitem.desc: Specifies the minimum number of low intensity pixels (every 1000 pixels) in the image in order to activate the Mobile Phone mode.

tagitem.name: CI_MOBILE_PHONE_SATURATION_RATE
tagitem.desc: Specifies the minimum number of saturated pixels (every 1000 pixels) in the image in order to activate the Mobile Phone mode.

tagitem.name: CI_MOBILE_PHONE_DARK_THRESHOLD
tagitem.desc: Threshold used to determine if a pixel has low intensity level in Mobile Phone mode.

tagitem.name: CI_READ_MODE
tagitem.desc: Configures the scanner's mode of reading labels
tagitem.notes:
Trigger Single: When trigger is pulled, scanning is activated and the aiming pattern and the illuminator swicth ON, until CI_ELAPSE_TIME has elapsed, or label has been read, or trigger is released.
Trigger hold multiple: When trigger is pulled, scanning is activated until CI_ELAPSE_TIME has elapsed, or the trigger is released. CI_DOUBLE_READ_TIMEOUT gates double reads while in this mode.
Trigger pulse multiple: When trigger is pulled, scanning is activated and continues after trigger is released until CI_ELAPSE_TIME has elapsed, or the trigger pulled again. CI_DOUBLE_READ_TIMEOUT gates double reads while in this mode.
Flashing: The Illuminator flashes on and off regardless of the trigger status. Flash rate is controlled by CI_FLASH_ON and CI_FLASH_OFF.
Always on: The illuminator is always on and and the reader always ready for reading. CI_DOUBLE_READ_TIMEOUT gates double reads while in this mode.
Object Detection: When in this mode the scanner looks for scene changes within its field-of-view. The Aiming Pattern is always on to help the user to find the right position of the reading area. If a predetermined amount of change in the scene is detected the reader switches the red illumination on. Scanning continues until a label is read or the "maximum scan on time" is reached.
Additional Notes: - Trigger Object sense is a feature not applicable, even is option value in a BT system is accepted by base station. That value is accepted for compatibility with 1D readers but the system composed by 2D HH BT behave as: in default option Trigger Single.
- All decoding options like Inverse Reading or Multiple Reading can be configured regardless the reading mode option selected.
- The Tag name for option value: 05=Stand Mode changed into 05=Object Detection within the first maintenance release. (called stand mode till Columbus M86)

tagitem.name: CI_MANUAL_TO_WATCH_TIMEOUT
tagitem.desc: Specifies the amount of time the scanner takes the Illuminator OFF, after a decoded label when in stand reading mode.
tagitem.notes: Specifies the amount of time the scanner takes the Illuminator OFF, after a decoded label when in stand reading mode.

tagitem.name: CI_PICK_MODE_AIMING_DURATION_TIME
tagitem.desc: Specifies the frame of time the aiming pointer remains on after decoding a label or after the trigger is released, when in trigger single mode and Pick Mode is enabled.

tagitem.name: CI_AUTOMATIC_DIGITAL_GAIN
tagitem.desc: Enables/Disables the digital gain when exposure mode is not manual

tagitem.name: CI_MANUAL_DIGITAL_GAIN
tagitem.desc: Enables/Disables the digital gain when manual exposure is selected.

tagitem.name: CI_EXPOSURE_BRIGHTNESS_TARGET
tagitem.desc: Sets the desired luminosity of the image.

tagitem.name: CI_EXPOSURE_MODE
tagitem.desc: Configures the scanner to use automatic or manual exposure mode.

values.value: Automatic with reset to Eposure Period value
Automatic with reset to last trigger value

tagitem.notes: 00=Manual 01=Automatic with exposure reset to value contained in CI_EXPOSURE_PERIOD on every trigger pull 02=Automatic with exposure reset the last value calculated on every trigger pull

tagitem.name: CI_SENSOR_STANDBY_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Configures the ability of the scanner to enable/disable the sensor standby mode
tagitem.notes: Normally the sensor standby is always active to save power for the end user. The ability to configure this item is used for internal puposes.

tagitem.name: CI_MANUAL_ILLUMINATOR_CONTROL
tagitem.desc: Sets the manual activation of Illumination

tagitem.name: CI_MANUAL_EXPOSURE_GAIN
tagitem.desc: Sets the manual exposure gain

tagitem.name: CI_STAR_RADIO_PROTOCOL_TIMEOUT
tagitem.desc: Specifies how much time the Gun (Handheld)can wait before signalling a transmission failure.

tagitem.name: CI_STAR_TX_MODE
tagitem.desc: Specifies the transmission protocol for Star communications.
tagitem.notes: A one way transaction ends when the base station receive data. A two way transaction ends when the base station sends an answer back to the gun. The answer can be a the message coming from the Host or an empty data frame generated automatically by the base station

tagitem.name: CI_AIMING_POINTER_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enabes/disables aiming pointer for all symbologies
tagitem.notes: The aiming system can be enabled to indicate the reading area of the potential code to be captured.

tagitem.name: CI_INDUSTRIAL_2OF5_AIM_ID_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables/Disables AIM ID for Industrial 2 of 5
tagitem.notes: Effective only when CI_ALL_AIM_ID_ENABLE is disabled.

tagitem.name: CI_INDUSTRIAL_2OF5_CHECK_CHARACTER_CALCULATION
tagitem.desc: Enables/Disables calculation and verification of optional Industrial 2 of 5 check character

tagitem.name: CI_INDUSTRIAL_2OF5_CHECK_CHARACTER_TRANSMISSION
tagitem.desc: Enables/disables transmission of Industrail 2 of 5 check character

tagitem.name: CI_INDUSTRIAL_2OF5_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables/Disables ability of scanner to decode Industrial 2 of 5 labels.
tagitem.notes: This item must be enabled also to decode a symbology called Discrete 2 0f 5. In that case is necessary to enable additionally CI_STANDARD_2OF5_ENABLE

tagitem.name: CI_LABEL_ID_INDUSTRIAL_2OF5
tagitem.desc: Specifies Industrial 2 of 5 label ID to be added to label data
tagitem.notes: The label ID is 3 bytes. The 3 bytes are characters for the label ID. A 00 (hex) value in the first 3 bytes indicates the end of the label ID characters.

tagitem.name: CI_INDUSTRIAL_2OF5_LENGTH_1
tagitem.desc: Specifies one of the barcode lengths for Industrial 2 of 5 length control
tagitem.notes: Length 1 is the minimum label length if in variable length mode, or the first fixed length if in fixed length mode. Length includes the barcodes check and data characters.

tagitem.name: CI_INDUSTRIAL_2OF5_LENGTH_2
tagitem.desc: Specifies one of the barcode lengths for Industrial 2 of 5 length control
tagitem.notes:
Length 2 is the maximum label length if in variable length mode, or the second fixed length if in fixed length mode. Length includes the barcodes check and data characters.
00 = Ignore this length and use only one fixed length

tagitem.name: CI_INDUSTRIAL_2OF5_LENGTH_CONTROL
tagitem.desc: Specifies either variable-length decoding or fixed-length decoding for Industrial 2 of 5
tagitem.notes: For variable-length decoding, a minimum length may be set; for fixed-length decoding, two different lengths may be set

tagitem.name: CI_UCC_EAN128_2D_COMPONENT_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Controls requirement that a 2D label component be decoded when an GS1-128 base label is decoded.

tagitem.name: CI_EAN128_AIM_ID_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables/Disables AIM ID for GS1-128
tagitem.notes: Effective only when CI_ALL_AIM_ID_ENABLE is disabled.

tagitem.name: CI_EAN128_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables/disables scanner to translate GS1-128 labels to the GS1-128 data format

values.value: Transmit EAN128 labels in Code128 data format
Transmit EAN128 labels in EAN128 data format

tagitem.notes: EAN128 labels are a special format of Code128 labels.

tagitem.name: CI_LABEL_ID_EAN128
tagitem.desc: Specifies GS1-128 label ID to be added to label data
tagitem.notes: The label ID is 3 bytes. The 3 bytes are characters for the label ID. A 00 (hex) value in the first 3 bytes indicates the end of the label ID characters.

tagitem.name: CI_EAN128_COMPOSITE_AIM_ID_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables/Disables AIM ID for GS1-128 Composite
tagitem.notes: Effective only when CI_ALL_AIM_ID_ENABLE is disabled.

tagitem.name: CI_LABEL_ID_EAN128_COMPOSITE
tagitem.desc: Specifies GS1-128 Composite label ID to be added to label data
tagitem.notes: The label ID is 3 bytes. The 3 bytes are characters for the label ID. A 00 (hex) value in the first 3 bytes indicates the end of the label ID characters.

tagitem.name: CI_UPCEAN_QUIET_ZONE
tagitem.desc: Specifies the number of quiet zones for UPC/EAN
tagitem.notes: The property apply to all EAN-UPC symbologies globally and to the ADDONs.

tagitem.name: CI_USB_SUSPEND_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables/Disables the ability of USB interfaces to enter suspend mode

tagitem.name: CI_DATABAR_EXPANDED_2D_COMPONENT_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Controls requirement that a 2D label component be decoded when an GS1 DataBar Expanded base label is decoded.
tagitem.notes: When enabled, if an RSS Expanded label is decoded which has the 2D linkage flag set, the 2D component must also be decoded or the base label will be discarded. When disabled, only the RSS Expanded base label will be decoded and transmitted regardless of the state of the linkage flag.

tagitem.name: CI_DATABAR_EXPANDED_AIM_ID_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables/Disables AIM ID for GS1 DataBar Expanded
tagitem.notes: Effective only when CI_ALL_AIM_ID_ENABLE is disabled.

tagitem.name: CI_DATABAR_EXPANDED_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables/disables ability of scanner to decode GS1 DataBar-Expanded labels. Only functional if value added feature for GS1 DataBar is activated

tagitem.name: CI_LABEL_ID_DATABAR_EXPANDED
tagitem.desc: Specifies GS1 DataBar-Expanded label ID to be added to label data
tagitem.notes: The label ID is 3 bytes. The 3 bytes are characters for the label ID. A 00 (hex) value in the first 3 bytes indicates the end of the label ID characters.

tagitem.name: CI_DATABAR_EXPANDED_LENGTH_1
tagitem.desc: Specifies one of the barcode lengths for GS1 DataBar Expanded length control.
tagitem.notes: Length 1 is the minimum label length if in variable length mode, or the first fixed length if in fixed length mode. Length includes the barcodes data characters only.

tagitem.name: CI_DATABAR_EXPANDED_LENGTH_2
tagitem.desc: Specifies one of the barcode lengths for GS1 DataBar Expanded length control.

values.value: Ignore this length. Only one fixed length.

tagitem.notes: Length 2 is the maximum label length if in variable length mode, or the second fixed length if in fixed length mode. Length includes the barcodes data characters only.

tagitem.name: CI_DATABAR_EXPANDED_LENGTH_CONTROL
tagitem.desc: Specifies either variable-length decoding or fixed-length decoding for GS1 DataBar Expanded
tagitem.notes: For variable-length decoding, a minimum length may be set; for fixed-length decoding, two different lengths may be set

tagitem.name: CI_DATABAR_EXPANDED_EAN128_EMULATION
tagitem.desc: Enables/disables GS1-128 emulation for GS1 DataBar Expanded

tagitem.name: CI_DATABAR_EXPANDED_COMPOSITE_AIM_ID_ENABLE
tagitem.desc: Enables/Disables AIM ID for GS1 DataBar Expanded Composite
tagitem.notes: Effective only when CI_ALL_AIM_ID_ENABLE is disabled.

tagitem.name: CI_LABEL_ID_DATABAR_EXPANDED_COMPOSITE
tagitem.desc: Specifies GS1 DataBar Expanded Composite label ID to be added to label data.
tagitem.notes: The label ID is 3 bytes. The 3 bytes are characters for the label ID. A 00 (hex) value in the first 3 bytes indicates the end of the label ID characters.
